title: As a BOC user I want to be able to load the users for an Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the selected Org.  
* BOC users are able to pick a specific Org and leave "User" set to "All" and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified Org's user ids per the wireframe.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to load the users by Role
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* BOC users are able to pick a specific Role and leave "User" set to "All" and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified Org's user ids that have been assigned the selected role per the wireframe.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to view the new User Accounts utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under "System" there is a User Accounts tab.
* Launching this tab will display the utility per the wireframe. 
* Browser tab text says "User Accounts"
* The options available under ORG will be BOC, Unassigned and the 30 Clubs.
* The "User" dropdown default will be "All" 
* When User is set to All there is also a "Role" dropdown available. 
* The Role dropdown should default to All. 
* When User is set to a value other than "All" the Role dropdown should no longer be available. 
* There is a "View" button available on the screen.

title: As a Club user I want to view the new User Accounts utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under "System" there is a User Accounts tab.
* Launching this tab will display the utility per the wireframe. 
* There will be no Org dropdown for Club users, or it will default to their own Club and not be editable (whichever is easier).
* The "User" dropdown default will be "All" 
* When User is set to All there is also a "Feature" dropdown available. 
* The feature dropdown contains a list of all available system features. 
* When User is set to a value other than "All" the Feature dropdown should no longer be available. 
* When an individual feature is selected there is also a "Role" dropdown available. 
* The Role dropdown should default to All. 
* The Role dropdown should have a list of available Roles for the selected feature. 
* When Feature is set to "All" the Role dropdown should no longer be available. 
* There is a "View" button available on the screen.

title: New BOC User Account utility - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created to view the new BOC User Account utility.
* A new LDAP is created to edit the new BOC User Account utility.
* BOC Users who have either LDAP see the "Utilities" Left Navigation menu. 
* Users who have either LDAP see the "User Accounts" tab under the System Left Navigation menu and see the Tab on the System dashboard. Users without either permission do not see this. 
* Clicking on "User Accounts" will load the utility per previously delivered stories.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see an Edit button when viewing individual users.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see the "update selected users" portion of the screen. 
* If the user does have edit permissions, they are able to edit appropriately. 
* As part of delivering this story - please add the Editor permission to test_boc_approver account, and the viewer permission to the test_boc_viewer account.

title: New Club User Account utility - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created to view the new Club User Account utility.
* A new LDAP is created to edit the new Club User Account utility.
* Club Users who have either LDAP see the "Utilities" Left Navigation menu. 
* Users who have either LDAP see the "User Accounts" tab under the System Left Navigation menu and see the Tab on the System dashboard. Users without either permission do not see this. 
* Clicking on "User Accounts" will load the utility per previously delivered stories.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see an Edit button when viewing individual users.
* If the user does have edit permissions, they are able to edit appropriately. 
* As part of delivering this story - the Viewer permission should be added to a newly created ebis-system-club-viewer-role.
* As part of delivering this story - the Editor permission should be added to the existing ebis-system-club-admin-role.

title: New IT User Account utility - Permissions
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created to view the new IT User Account utility.
* A new LDAP is created to edit the new IT User Account utility.
* Users who have either LDAP see the "System" Left Navigation menu. 
* Users who have either LDAP see the "Roles & Permissions" tab under the System Left Navigation menu and see the Tab on the Utilities dashboard. Users without either permission do not see this. 
* Clicking on "Roles & Permissions" will load the utility per previously delivered stories.
* If the user does NOT have edit permissions, they do not see any of the action buttons when viewing the screen. (Edit, Create New, Sync, etc.) 
* If the user does have edit permissions, they are able to edit appropriately. 
* As part of delivering this story - the Viewer permission should be added to a newly created ebis-system-permissions-boc-viewer-role.
* As part of delivering this story - the Editor permission should be added to the existing ebis-system-permissions-boc-admin-role.

title: As a Club user I want to be able to load the users for my Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the viewing Org.  
* Club users are able to leave "User" set to "All" and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified Org's user ids per the wireframe. 
* For each user the system will show a comma separated list of the users' roles, using the English Language description of the role (Ex: MJ Transactions Club Admin).

title: As a BOC user I want to add a new individual LDAP to a user account
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria:
* In edit mode there is an "Add Individual Permission" dropdown. 
* This dropdown has every NON role permission available in the system in a searchable dropdown.
* Selecting a permission will add the individual permission to the "Individual Permissions" section of the utility. 
* The permission is saved to the user when the form is saved.

title: As a Club user I want to be able to load only users for my Org that have certain Roles
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When the "User" dropdown is set to "All" and and Feature and/or Role selections have been applied, clicking "View" will load the relevant user ids per the wireframe.

title: As a Club user I want to load the permissions for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the selected Org. 
* Club users are able to pick a specific user id and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified user id per the wireframe. 
* Each available feature will display with the selected roles for the user under the Features section of the utility. The roles will display as the user friendly description of each role ex: MJ Transactions Club Admin. 
* Any permissions the user has that have been added outside of a role are displayed in the "Individual Permissions" section.

title: As a Club user I want to edit the roles for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is an Edit button available on the Club version of the screen.
* Clicking "Edit" will load the utility in edit mode per the wireframe. 
* There will be a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button available in edit mode.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel all changes. If the user confirms, the utility is reloaded in View mode with no changes made to the relevant user account. If the user does not confirm, they are returned to the utility in edit mode with their current edits still available. 
* The user will be able to set each Feature to "None" or to one of the Roles associated with the feature. 
* The "Individual Permissions" section of the screen is entirely uneditable for Club users. 
* Clicking "Save" will update the relevant user account by removing any roles and associated permissions that have been removed, and adding any roles and associated permissions that have been added.

title: As a Club user I want to edit the role assigned to a user for a specific feature
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a Club user changes a feature's role selection for an existing user, the system should remove the previously selected Role and its associated permissions from the user account, and subsequently add the newly selected Role and its associated permissions (Ex: Changing a MJC Admin to a MJC Viewer). 
* Ensure that the remove is done FIRST so that the overlapping roles are not wiped clean accidentally.
*Note that typically the reporting roles are overlapping so they would be a good thing to check out to ensure this works properly*

title: As a as a BOC user with user account utility admin permission I want to see the LDAP Mapping utility
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions

Acceptance Criteria:
* Under "System" there is a Roles & Permissions tab.
* Launching this tab will display the utility per the wireframe. 
* The "Roles" portion of the utility will display all of the current roles available for ebis. (ex: ebis-mjc-club-viewer-role)
* Each Role will have an expansion section that will contain all of the indvidual groups that are mapped to that role.
* The user will also be able to view the Feature related to the role, where applicable, as well as the English Language description of the role. 
* The "Unmapped Permissions" portion of the utility will display any individual group that is not currently found to be associated with any Role.

title: As a BOC user I want to load the permissions for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "User" dropdown will contain all of the user ids associated with the selected Org. 
* BOC users are able to pick a specific user id and click "View". 
* Clicking "View" will load the specified user id per the wireframe.

title: As a BOC user I want to edit the permissions for an individual user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Once a user id has been loaded in the utility, there is an "Edit" button on the page. 
* Clicking "Edit" will place the page in edit mode, replacing the Edit button with a Save button and a Cancel button. 
* Clicking the Cancel button will ask the user to confirm that they are OK losing changes, and if the user confirms, reload the page in view mode with no changes made to the selected user id. 
* While in Edit mode, there is a dropdown that the user can use to select a new Role to add to the userid being edited. 
* Selecting a Role from the dropdown will add the Role to the screen. 
* In edit mode the user will also see trash cans associated with each Role the user has, and be able to remove the user from any of its current roles using the trash cans. 
* No changes are maintained until the user clicks "Save". 
* Clicking "Save" reloads the page in View mode, with the changes made to the user id's account maintained. 
* If a role has been added more than once to the same userID, do not add it for a second time (control duplicate roles this way).

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to bulk add a role to users within an Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=updated_selected_users

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing the User Accounts utility and there is a list of users loaded, there is a column of checkboxes allowing the user to check off one or more of the users displayed.
* Once at least one user has been checked, the "Add Roles to  Selected" dropdown enables. It is disabled until at least one is checked.
* The dropdown contains a searchable list of each Role available in the system, using the "User Friendly" role description. 
* Once at least one role has been selected, the "Add Roles" button becomes enabled. 
* Clicking "Add Roles" will add the selected roles to the selected user ids, along with all of the underlying permissions associated with the selected roles. 
* A blue success message displays "X Accounts updated successfully", with X being replaced with the number of user ids updated.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to export the detailed permissions for all of the users within an Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing the User Accounts utility and there is a list of users loaded, there is an Export button available.
* Clicking "Export" will download an Excel spreadsheet of all of the user ids displayed, along with their Roles and their detailed permissions. 
*Example in comments*

title: As a Club user I want to be able to export the detailed permissions for all of the users within my Org
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user is viewing the User Accounts utility and there is a list of users loaded, there is an Export button available.
* Clicking "Export" will download an Excel spreadsheet of all of the user ids displayed, along with their Roles and their detailed permissions. 
*Example in comments*

title: As s a BOC user with user account utility admin permissions I want to be able to create a new LDAP
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=create_new_permission

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Roles and Permissions utility, there is a Create New Permission button visible in edit or view mode.
* Clicking the Create New Permission button will launch the create new permission modal per the wireframe.
* On the modal there is a text field where the user can enter the new permission.
* The user can add multiple rows by clicking the "Add Row" button. 
* Once more than one row exists, each row has a trash can icon available, with clicking the trash can icon removing the relevant row. 
* If only one row is present, there is no trash can icon. 
* Once text is entered in the modal for each added row, the "Save" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Save" will add the selected permissions to the database and the corresponding environment's LDAP. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no permissions being added.
* Newly added permissions will appear in the "Unmapped Permissions" portion of the utility and be available to add to existing roles.

title: As a as a BOC User with user account utility admin permissions I want to be able to create a new role
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=create_new_role

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Roles and Permissions utility, there is a Create New Role button visible in edit or view mode.
* Clicking the Create New Role button will launch the create new role modal per the wireframe.
* On the modal there is a text field where the user can enter the new role (ex: ebis-mj-transactions-boc-admin-role).
* The user will have the ability to indicate whether this is a Club only role, to enter the user facing description and select the relevant feature.
* The user can also select one or more existing permissions to map to the new role by using a searchable dropdown of available non-role permissions.
* Once all required fields are completed in the modal for each added row, the "Save" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Save" will add the new Role to the database and the corresponding environment's LDAP and map the role as described in the modal. A blue successful save notification will display.  
* The new role will now appear in the utility. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no role being added.
*Note that this works independently of the form's edit/save capabilities, even if the form is in edit mode at the time the button is clicked*

title: As a BOC user with user account utility permission I want to be able to create a new role from a template
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=create_new_role_from_template

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Roles and Permissions utility, there is a Create New Role from Template button visible in edit or view mode.
* Clicking the Create New Role from Template button will launch the create new role from template modal per the wireframe.
* On the modal the user can select an existing role to re-create. 
* Once they select a role, the modal will update to display all of the permissions available for the selected role, allowing the user to add and remove additional permissions. 
* On the modal there is a text field where the user can enter the new role (ex: ebis-mj-transactions-boc-admin-role).
* The user will have the ability to indicate whether this is a Club only role, to enter the user facing description and select the relevant feature.
* The user can also select one or more existing permissions to map to the new role by using a searchable dropdown of available non-role permissions.
* The user can add multiple rows of permissions by clicking the "Add Row" button. 
* Once more than one row exists, each row has a trash can icon available, with clicking the trash can icon removing the relevant row. 
* If only one row is present, there is no trash can icon. 
* Once all required fields are completed in the modal for each added row, the "Save" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Save" will add the new Role to the database and the corresponding environment's LDAP and map the role as described in the modal. A blue successful save notification will display.  
* The new role will now appear in the utility. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no role being added.
*Note that this works independently of the form's edit/save capabilities, even if the form is in edit mode at the time the button is clicked*

title: As a as a BOC user with user account utility admin permission  I want to be able to delete an existing role or permission
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Roles and Permissions utility, there is an Edit button.
* Clicking edit will place the form in edit mode. 
* While in edit mode there is a trash can button next to each Role, and also a trash can icon next to each individual permission under "Unmapped Permissions".
* Clicking the trash can icon will remove the Role or individual permission from the utility.
* Clicking "Save" will permanently delete the role LDAP or the unmapped permission from LDAP. If a role is being deleted, the underlying permissions are not touched, just the role is deleted and removed from BOC and Club utilities. 

*Note that to delete an individual permission they must be removed from all relevant roles first so that they appear in the "Unmapped Permission" section.

title: As a BOC user with user account utility admin permission  I want to be able to edit an existing Role
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the IT User Accounts utility, there is an Edit button.
* Clicking edit will place the form in edit mode. 
* While in edit mode there is a Cancel button. Clicking Cancel will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, their changes are discarded and the form is returned to view mode with none of the changes stored. If they do not confirm, the modal is closed and the user is returned to the form in edit mode to continue making edits. 
* While in edit mode, the Club Role checkbox for each role is clickable. Checking this will enable the role to appear as an option in the Club facing utility under the selected feature. Note that if a feature is not selected it will not appear on the utility, even if Club Role is selected. Unchecking this will remove the role from the relevant feature on the Club utility.
* While in edit mode, each permission underneath a role has a trash can icon. Clicking the trash can icon will remove the permission from the role - it will NOT delete the LDAP group entirely, it will just remove the association from the role. 
* The user is also able to select a Feature to associate the Role with.
* The user is also able to type in a User Friendly description of the role that is used in both the BOC and Club utilities. 
* Adding new permissions is covered in another story. 
* Clicking "Save" will commit all of these changes, and display a blue successful save notification.

title: As a BOC user with user account admin utility permission  I want to be able to add permissions to an existing Role
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=add_permissions_to_a_role

Acceptance Criteria: 
* While the IT utility is in edit mode, there is an Add Permissions button contained within each Role. 
* Clicking the "Add Permissions" button will launch a modal in which the user can select a permission to add to the relevant role.
* On the modal there is a searchable dropdown where the user can add any non-role permission.
* The user can add multiple rows by clicking the "Add Row" button. 
* Once more than one row exists, each row has a trash can icon available, with clicking the trash can icon removing the relevant row. 
* If only one row is present, there is no trash can icon. 
* Once a group is selected in the modal for each added row, the "Add" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Add" will add the selected permissions to the relevant Role. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no permissions being added to any role. 
* Clicking "Save" on the IT Utility will commit the changes, and display a blue successful save notification.

title: As a user I want to have a link to the new user/update access request form from the user accounts page
custom_steps: Wireframe: http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts Acceptance Criteria: * When viewing the User Accounts Listing tab, users see a link "Request new user or additional permissions" Embed link provided by Sean:
